intro: Bufonia tenuifolia subsp. multiflora, commonly known as the narrowleaf bufonia, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its fruits are dry, two-lobed schizocarps, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
